classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D or E.

USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D or E.
Any free elective can go here. If GE courses are used to satisfy Support or Concentration requirements, additional free elective units may be required to satisfy 180 units for degree.

Individualized Course of Study. A minimum of 24 units of coursework, of which a minimum of 12 units must be RPTA prefix, and a minimum of 4 units must be Upper Division. Courses are selected by the student in consultation with the student's academic advisor, and the ICS must be approved by the academic advisor.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
See catalog for options. Courses taken in the Support Elective area cannot double count in Concentration.
